00011 using namespace std;

00013 OROrcaRequestFitProcessor::OROrcaRequestFitProcessor() 
00014 {
00015   /* Inputs required. Vector sizes can change*/
00016   SetInput("FitLowerBound", &fIntLower, "Lower bound of the fit");
00017   SetInput("FitUpperBound", &fIntUpper, "Upper bound of the fit");
00018   SetInput("FitFunction", &fFitFunc, 
00019     "Fit Function, either custom or predefined (see ROOT TFormula)");
00020   SetInput("FitParameters", &fInputParameters, 
00021     "Input parameters, not required for predefined functions");
00022   SetInput("FitOptions", &fFitOptions, "Fit Options");
00023   SetInput("FitYValues", &fYVector, "Y values to fit");
00024 
00025   /* Outputs sent back to Orca. */
00026   SetOutput("FitOutputYValues", &fOutputYVector, "Fitted Y values");
00027   SetOutput("FitOutputParameters", &fOutputParamVector, "Parameter list of fit");
00028   SetOutput("FitOutputParametersNames", &fOutputParamNamesVector, 
00029     "Parameter name list of fit");
00030   SetOutput("FitOutputErrorParameters", &fOutputParamErrorsVector, 
00031     "Error Parameter list of fit");
00032   SetOutput("FitChiSquare", &fOutputChiSquare, "Calculated chi-square of the fit");
00033   SetOutput("FitEquation", &fOutputEquation, "Output equation with fit values");
00034 }
00035 
00036 bool OROrcaRequestFitProcessor::ExecuteProcess()
00037 {
00038   if (fYVector.size() == 0) {
00039     ORLog(kError) << "Size 0 for input y array. " << endl;
00040     return false;
00041   }
00042   TF1* f1 = new TF1("f1", fFitFunc.c_str());
00043   if (!f1) {
00044     ORLog(kError) << "Error allocating function for: " << fFitFunc <<  endl;
00045     return false;
00046   }
00047   if (f1->GetExpFormula().Sizeof() <= 1) {
00048     /* Good indication that it was unable to parse; fail here.*/
00049     ORLog(kError) << "Error parsing fit function.  Not well-formed." << endl;
00050     return false;
00051   }
00052   std::string histName = "temp";
00053   TGraph* graph = new TGraph(fYVector.size());
00054   if (!graph) {
00055     ORLog(kError) << "Error allocating graph." <<  endl;
00056     return false;
00057   }
00058   for (size_t i=0;i<fYVector.size();i++) {
00059     graph->SetPoint(i, i, fYVector[i]);
00060   }
00061 
00062   /***************************************************/
00063   /* Checking the parameters.  If none have come in, then we zero them out. */
00064   /***************************************************/
00065   if (fInputParameters.size() != 0) {
00066     if (fInputParameters.size() != (size_t)f1->GetNpar()) { 
00067       ORLog(kError) << "Incorrect number of parameters...trying to continue" 
00068         << endl;
00069     }
00070     fInputParameters.resize(f1->GetNpar(), 0.);
00071   } else {
00072     fInputParameters.clear();
00073     fInputParameters.resize(f1->GetNpar(), 0.);
00074   } 
00075   for (size_t i=0;i<fInputParameters.size();i++) {
00076     f1->SetParameter(i, fInputParameters[i]);
00077   }
00078   /***************************************************/
00079   /***************************************************/
00080   
00081   if (fIntUpper < fIntLower) {
00082     /* Making sure we're getting correct bounds. */
00083     ORLog(kWarning) << "Bound parameters incorrect, trying to continue." << endl; 
00084     int temp = fIntUpper;
00085     fIntUpper = fIntLower;
00086     fIntLower = temp;
00087   }
00088   if (fYVector.size() < (size_t)fIntUpper) fIntUpper = fYVector.size();
00089 
00090   fFitOptions+="NQ"; // don't store, be quiet
00091   graph->Fit(f1, fFitOptions.c_str(), "", fIntLower, fIntUpper);
00092   /* Actually performing the fit.  (All this for one line of code!!!) */
00093 
00094   /* Now sorting out output parameters and loading them with correct
00095    * data.  */
00096   fOutputParamVector.resize(f1->GetNpar());
00097   fOutputParamErrorsVector.resize(f1->GetNpar());
00098   fOutputParamNamesVector.resize(f1->GetNpar());
00099 
00100   fOutputParamVector.assign(f1->GetParameters(), 
00101     f1->GetParameters()+f1->GetNpar());
00102   fOutputParamErrorsVector.assign(f1->GetParErrors(),
00103     f1->GetParErrors()+f1->GetNpar());
00104   for (size_t i=0;i<fOutputParamNamesVector.size();i++) {
00105     fOutputParamNamesVector[i] = f1->GetParName(i);
00106   }
00107   fOutputYVector.resize(((size_t)fIntUpper<=fYVector.size()) ? fIntUpper : fYVector.size());
00108   for (size_t i=0;i<fOutputYVector.size();i++) {
00109     fOutputYVector[i] = (i<(size_t)fIntLower) ? 0. : f1->Eval(i);
00110   }
00111   fOutputEquation = f1->GetExpFormula();
00112   /* This is useful if a user-defined equation was input. */
00113 
00114   fOutputChiSquare = (f1->GetNDF()==0) ? 0 : f1->GetChisquare()/f1->GetNDF(); 
00115   
00116   fInputParameters.clear();
00117   delete graph; 
00118   delete f1;
00119 
00120   return true;
00121 }

00123 OROrcaRequestFitProcessor::~OROrcaRequestFitProcessor()
00124 {
00125 }
